content:
I do not have personal experiences, but here are some recommendations to avoid getting seasick on a cruise:

1. choose a cabin in the middle of the ship, near the waterline.
2. avoid cabins at the front or back of the ship.
3. keep your eyes on the horizon.
4. take motion sickness medication, if recommended by your doctor or pharmacist.
5. limit alcohol consumption.
6. eat light, bland meals.
7. stay hydrated.

as for the best activities to do onboard, it depends on individual preferences, but some popular options include:

1. relaxing in the spa or on the beach.
2. participating in onboard activities such as trivia, games, and demonstrations.
3. attending shows or concerts.
4. taking part in shore excursions to explore different destinations.
5. trying different types of cuisine and dining experiences.
6. enjoying the swimming pools and waterslides.
7. shopping and exploring the onboard shops.
8. joining fitness classes and working out at the gym.
